# basics

- three dash .red[`---`] indicates a new slide, and will not be rendered as a horizontal rule .red[`<hr />`]

- two dash .red[`--`] adds content Incrementally

- .red[`.class[content]`] styles the .red[content] with the specified .red[`class`]. for example, .red[.footnote[`.footnote[content]` leaves the content in the bottom place]].red[`.footnote[contents]`] leaves the content in the bottom place

- fance code prefixed with a .red[`*`] will get highlighted with a yellow background,  which can brings attention to specific parts of code snippets when set .red[`highlightLines: true`]

- for full reference, look the [remark.js](https://github.com/gnab/remark/wiki/Markdown#slide-properties), [xaringan](https://github.com/yihui/xaringan) and [book](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/xaringan.html)

layout: true

# property

---

initial lines of a slide on a key-value format will be extracted as slide properties:

- .red[`name: demo`] - gives the current slide an id .red[`demo`], which can be styled using .red[`#demo`], linked using .red[`[demo](#demo)`]

- .red[`class: center, middle`] - classes current slide. the following are default classes
  - left, center, right
  - top, middle, bottom
  - inverse
  
- .red[`background-image: url(image.jpg)`] - gives the current slide background image

- .red[`count: true|false`] - whether counted

---

- .red[`template: {{ name}}`] - uses another slide as its template and append new content

- .red[`layout: true|false`] - when .red[`true`], makes the current slide a layout slide, omitted from the slideshow and served as the default template for all subsequent slides. when .red[`false`], reverts to using no default template

- .red[`exclude: true|false`] - hides a slide, a way to filter that slide out so that it is not used at all in rendering

# layout 1

.pull-left[

.red[`.pull-left[contents]`] floats contents on the left of the slide

]

.pull-right[

.red[`.pull-right[contents]`] floats contents on the right of the slide

]

their width are same, both .red[`47%`] by default. they are best to show the comparable contents.

---

# layout 2

they are best to show outlines on the left, and the contents on the right.

.left-column[

.red[`.left-column[contents]`] floats the contents to the left column with width .red[`20%`] by default

]

.right-column[

.red[`.right-column[contents]`] floats the contents to the right column with width .red[`75%`] by default

]
